title: Organizational Learning Strategies Through Consumer Safety Complaint Analysis

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of advanced courses and extensive practical experience in specialized fields
context.additional_context: Project-based learning course exploring the connection between product safety improvements and organizational learning through analysis of actual consumer complaint data

learning_goals: Ability to explain methods for extracting and analyzing meaningful information from consumer safety complaint data
Ability to empirically demonstrate correlations between product design changes and safety complaints using data
Ability to compare safety complaint pattern differences across vehicle grades and apply findings to organizational learning strategies
The correlation between the launch timing of a new model and the incidence of safety complaints can be empirically analyzed.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
